<title level="1" right="Spell 3" pfs="Standard">[Familiar's Face](/Spells.aspx?ID=688)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Scrying" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=141" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 218 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Two Actions" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 1 mile

**Target** 1 willing creature that is your animal companion or familiar
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained
</row>

</column>

---

The target becomes a scrying sensor, allowing you to see through its eyes, smell what it smells, and similarly use its other senses. If you can cast a spell with the [revelation](/Traits.aspx?ID=138) trait that affects your senses, such as [_see invisibility_](/Spells.aspx?ID=271), while this spell is active, you gain the benefit of the spell through the target's senses instead of your own. You can also speak through the target, with a voice much like yours, though it takes on some of the timbre and character of the target's growls or squawks. You can use [Command an Animal](/Actions.aspx?ID=58) on the target as part of Sustaining this Spell. You don't need line of sight or line of effect to your target when you Cast this Spell.
name: Familiar's Face
